title.value: Validation of an AI-assisted Treatment Outcome Measure for Gender-Affirming Voice Care: Comparing AI Accuracy to Listener’s Perception of Voice Femininity
title.justification: The title accurately reflects the core focus and objectives of the study, which is to validate an AI model in the context of gender-affirming voice care.
title.quote: Validation of an AI-assisted Treatment Outcome Measure for Gender-Affirming Voice Care: Comparing AI Accuracy to Listener’s Perception of Voice Femininity

extractions.description: This paper explores the validation of an AI model designed to assess voice femininity as a treatment measure in gender-affirming voice care, comparing its accuracy against human listeners' perception.

type.justification: The paper involves experimental validation and comparison of an AI model's accuracy against human perception, which qualifies as empirical research.
type.quote: The purpose of this study was to examine the feasibility of using this model as a treatment outcome measure by comparing its performance to human listeners.

name.justification: The research focuses specifically on outcomes related to gender-affirming voice care, a specialized area within medical treatment for transgender individuals.
name.quote: Objectives. There is currently a lack of objective treatment outcome measures for transgender individuals undergoing gender-affirming voice care.

name.justification: The paper utilizes AI models to measure voice femininity, indicating a focus within the broader domain of artificial intelligence.
name.quote: Recently, Bensoussan et al developed an AI model that is able to generate a voice femininity rating based on a short voice sample.

name.justification: The model is specifically named as being trained on the Perceptual Voice Quality Database within the study.
name.quote: (1) the AI model trained on a high-quality low-quantity dataset (voices from the Perceptual Voice Quality Database) (PVQD model)

is_contributed.justification: The model is referenced in the context of a previously published work, not directly contributed by this study.
is_contributed.quote: the previously published PVQD model achieved 84% accuracy

is_executed.justification: The study executed the model to compare its performance against human listeners.
is_executed.quote: Human ratings were compared to ratings generated by the AI model trained on a high-quality low-quantity dataset.

is_compared.justification: The PVQD model's performance was compared against both human ratings and another model.
is_compared.quote: Human ratings were compared to ratings generated by (1) the AI model trained on a high-quality low-quantity dataset.

referenced_paper_title.value: Bensoussan et al developed an AI model
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper credits Bensoussan et al with the development of the PVQD model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Recently, Bensoussan et al developed an AI model that is able to generate a voice femininity rating.

name.justification: The model is specifically mentioned as being trained on the Mozilla Common Voice database in the study.
name.quote: (2) the AI model trained on a low-quality high-quantity dataset (voices from the Mozilla Common Voice database) (Mozilla model).

is_contributed.justification: The model was developed and implemented as part of the study's exploration of training data quality versus quantity.
is_contributed.quote: The Mozilla-trained model performed better than the PVQD-trained model.

is_executed.justification: The study executed the model to assess its performance and correlation with human ratings.
is_executed.quote: Human ratings were compared to ratings generated by the AI model trained on a low-quality high-quantity dataset.

is_compared.justification: The Mozilla model's performance was compared against both human ratings and another model's performance in the study.
is_compared.quote: The Mozilla-trained model showed a stronger correlation as well as lower overall rating ambiguity than the PVQD-trained model.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The study itself discusses the implementation and results of the Mozilla model as part of the research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The Mozilla-trained model performed better than the PVQD-trained model.

name.justification: This dataset is identified as the training source for the PVQD model in the study.
name.quote: (voices from the Perceptual Voice Quality Database) (PVQD model)

referenced_paper_title.justification: The study uses this dataset to train one of the AI models they compare.
referenced_paper_title.quote: AI model trained on a high-quality low-quantity dataset (voices from the Perceptual Voice Quality Database)

name.justification: The study utilizes this dataset as a training source for one of their AI models, namely the Mozilla model.
name.quote: (voices from the Mozilla Common Voice database) (Mozilla model)

referenced_paper_title.justification: The study directly uses this dataset to train the Mozilla model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: the AI model trained on a low-quality high-quantity dataset (voices from the Mozilla Common Voice database) (Mozilla model).
